<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Available
Information</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s principal
executive offices are located at 829 Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica, MA 01821;
telephone number 978-262-8700; corporate website www.as-e.com. We make
available, free of charge through our website, our annual Form&nbsp;10-K,
current reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q and Form&nbsp;8-K, and amendments to these
reports filed or furnished pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(a)&nbsp;of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 as soon as practicable. In addition, our
reports, proxy and information statements and other information filed with the
SEC are available at the SEC&#146;s Public Reference Room&nbsp;at 100 F Street, NE, Room&nbsp;1580,
Washington, DC 20549 (1-800-SEC-0330), and are also available from the SEC&#146;s
website at www.sec.gov.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM
1A.&#160; RISK FACTORS</font></b><a name="Item1a_RiskFactors_084433"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You should carefully
consider the following risk factors, in addition to other information included
in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K and other reports we file with the
Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160; If
any of the following risks occur, the Company&#146;s business, financial condition
and operating results could be materially adversely affected.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The Company&#146;s reliance on a small number of
customers for a large portion of its revenues could harm its business and
prospects.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s business is
dependent on sales to a small number of customers, which include agencies of
the United States government. During fiscal 2008, two customers accounted for
22% of the Company&#146;s total revenues. During fiscal 2007, two customers
accounted for 46% of the Company&#146;s total revenues, and during fiscal 2006, two
customers accounted for 56% of the Company&#146;s total revenues. Certain of the
Company&#146;s government contracts may be terminated at the government&#146;s
discretion. The termination of the Company&#146;s relationship with one or more of
its significant customers or the reduction or delay of orders of its systems by
these customers would substantially reduce the Company&#146;s revenues, and its
business and prospects may be harmed.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The Company conducts its business worldwide, which
exposes it to a number of difficulties in coordinating its international
activities and dealing with multiple regulatory environments.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s revenues to
international customers, including foreign governments, accounted for
approximately 36%, 27% and 14% of its net revenues for the fiscal years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, March&nbsp;31, 2007 and March&nbsp;31, 2006, respectively, and a
significant number of domestic customer orders require shipments to, and
services provided in, overseas locations. In addition, the </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-01.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:44 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company transacts business internationally with a
number of its key suppliers. As a result of the Company&#146;s worldwide business
operations, it is subject to various risks, including:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">international regulatory requirements and policy
changes;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">lengthy sales cycles;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">longer payment cycles by foreign customers;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">difficulties in inventory management, accounts
receivable collection and the management of distributors or representatives;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">difficulties in staffing and managing foreign
operations;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">geopolitical instability;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">political and economic changes and disruptions;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">favoritism towards local suppliers;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">governmental currency controls;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">interruption to transportation flow for delivery of
parts to us and finished goods to our customers;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">currency exchange rate fluctuations; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">tariff regulations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although the Company&#146;s international sales have been
denominated primarily in U.S. dollars, changes in currency exchange rates that
increase the relative value of the U.S. dollar may make it more difficult for
the Company to compete with foreign manufacturers on price or otherwise have a
material adverse effect on its sales and operating results.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The Company&#146;s lengthy sales cycle requires it to
incur significant expenses with no assurance that it will generate revenue or
recover such expenses.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A substantial portion of the Company&#146;s sales depends
upon the decision of governmental agencies to upgrade or expand security at
border crossing inspection sites, existing airports, seaports and other
facilities. Accordingly, a portion of the Company&#146;s product sales is subject to
delays associated with the lengthy approval processes that often accompany such
capital expenditures. During these approval periods, the Company expends
significant financial and managerial resources in anticipation of future orders
that may not occur. If the Company fails to receive an order after expending
these resources, it may be unable to generate sufficient revenue to recover the
costs incurred and its business and prospects may be harmed.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company&#146;s business is dependent upon governmental policies and appropriations.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s largest customers are government
agencies and demand for its products is dependent upon national priorities and
governmental initiatives, including defense-related programs. These priorities
and initiatives are subject to change from time to time in response to the
economic and political environment.&#160;&#160; The
Company is also exposed to the United States budget approval and appropriation
decisions and processes which are driven by numerous factors, including
geo-political events and macroeconomic conditions, and are beyond our control.
While the overall level of U.S. defense spending has increased in recent years
for numerous reasons, including increases in funding of operations in Iraq and
Afghanistan and the U.S. Department of Defense&#146;s military transformation
initiatives, we can give no assurance that such spending will continue to grow,
or not be reduced. Significant changes in defense spending could have long-term
consequences for our size and structure. In addition, changes in government
priorities and requirements could impact the funding, or the timing of funding,
of our programs which could negatively impact our results of operations and
financial condition.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Changes
in governmental regulations may reduce demand for the Company&#146;s products or
increase its expenses.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company competes in markets in which the Company
or its customers must comply with federal, state, local and foreign
regulations, such as health and safety regulations. The Company develops,
configures and markets its products to meet its customers&#146; needs created by
these regulations. Any significant change in these regulations could reduce
demand for the Company&#146;s products or increase its costs to comply with new
regulations, both of which may adversely affect its operating results.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-01.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:44 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The Company&#146;s reliance on a limited number of
suppliers for some key components for its products could harm its business and
prospects.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company relies on a
number of suppliers to provide material and subsystems for our products. The
Company is reliant on a number of key international supply partners for core
technology products, including subsystems with complex sub-tier supply chains.&#160; In addition, certain material or subsystems
used in our products may be available from a sole source or limited number of
suppliers, increasing the risk of supply disruption. Although our products may
be able to be redesigned to avoid using any sole source supplier, it would be
expensive and time consuming to make such a change. If the Company changes any
of its suppliers, a qualification process would need to be completed and the
affected product may require redesign, creating potential delays in product
shipments.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Some of our suppliers may
allocate material due to market demand for the products they produce or market
constraints such as the global availability of raw materials. We have no
guaranteed supply arrangements with our suppliers and there can be no assurance
that our suppliers will continue to meet our requirements. Many of our
competitors are much larger and may be able to obtain priority allocations from
these shared suppliers, thereby limiting or making our sources of supply
unreliable for these components. If our supply of materials is disrupted, we
cannot ensure that we would be able to find another supplier on a timely basis.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company depends on
its subcontractors and suppliers to deliver material that is in full compliance
with critical quality and specification requirements. Quality issues may affect
the reliability and performance of our products, customer confidence, and
adversely impact financial performance. Any difficulty in obtaining sufficient
and timely delivery of conforming material could result in delays or reductions
in product shipments that could materially and adversely affect our business,
financial condition and consolidated results of operations. This in turn could
also damage our reputation in the market and cause us to lose market share. The
Company does not expect to experience sustained difficulties in securing
required material and subsystems to support forward business operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fluctuations
in the Company&#146;s quarterly operating results may cause its stock price to
fluctuate.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Given the nature of the
markets in which the Company participates, it cannot reliably predict future
revenue and profitability. A high proportion of the Company&#146;s costs are fixed,
due in part to its significant sales, research and development, and
manufacturing costs. As a result of its fixed costs, small declines in revenue
could disproportionately affect the Company&#146;s operating results and stock price
in a quarter. Factors that may affect the Company&#146;s quarterly operating results
and the market price of its common stock include:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">demand for and market acceptance of its X-ray
inspection systems;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">lengthy sales cycles and the effect of large orders;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">changes in political agendas or national priorities;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">adverse changes in the level of economic activity in
regions in which the Company does business;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">political unrest in the regions where the Company
transacts business;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">adverse changes in industries on which the Company is
particularly dependent;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">competitive pressures resulting in lower selling prices
for its products;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">delays or problems in the introduction of new
products;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the Company&#146;s competitors&#146; announcement or
introduction of new products, services or technological innovations;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">variations in the Company&#146;s product mix;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the timing and amount of the Company&#146;s expenditures in
anticipation of future sales;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">increased costs of raw materials or supplies; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Symbol" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">changes in the volume or timing of product orders.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-01.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:44 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company could incur substantial costs as a result of product liability claims
and adverse publicity if its X-ray inspection systems fail to detect bombs,
explosives, weapons, contraband or other threats to personal safety.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If the Company&#146;s
X-ray inspection systems fail to detect the presence of bombs, explosives,
weapons, contraband or other threats to personal safety, the Company could be
subject to product liability claims and negative publicity, which could result
in increased costs, reduced sales, and a decline in the market price of the
Company&#146;s common stock. There are many factors beyond the Company&#146;s control
that could result in the failure of its products to detect the presence of
bombs, explosives, weapons, contraband or other threats to personal safety.
Examples of these factors include operator error or misuse of or malfunction of
its equipment. The failure of the Company&#146;s systems to detect the presence of
these dangerous materials may lead to personal injury, loss of life, and
extensive property damage and may result in potential claims against the
Company.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company&#146;s insurance may be insufficient to protect it from product liability
claims.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
product liability and umbrella liability insurance may be insufficient to
protect it from product liability claims. Moreover, there is a risk that
product liability insurance will not continue to be available to the Company at
a reasonable cost, if at all. If liability claims exceed the Company&#146;s current
or available insurance coverage, its business and prospects may be harmed.
Regardless of the adequacy of the Company&#146;s product liability insurance
protection, any significant claim may have an adverse affect on its industry
and market reputation, leading to a substantial decrease in demand for its
products and reduced revenues.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company may not be able to fund its research and development activities.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
generates funds for its research and development activities from operations,
private sources and the government. The Company may be unable to generate the
funds necessary to support its research and development activities if it does
not generate sufficient funds from operations, other potential private sources,
or the government. The Company may not successfully compete with other
companies and research institutions for government funding and funding from
other private sources. Additionally, government-funding priorities are subject
to frequent changes. For example, in fiscal 2008, 2007, and 2006, the Company
recorded $13,978,000, $6,597,000 and $2,804,000, respectively, for
government-sponsored research and development. There is no guarantee that the
Company will receive funds for government-sponsored research in the future. If
the Company is unable to fund its research and development activities through
its operations or from outside sources, the Company may be unable to continue
to innovate or bring its innovations to market on a timely or cost effective
basis, or its innovations may be surpassed by other competitors or new technologies.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company&#146;s success depends on new product development.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
continuing research and development program is designed to develop new products
and to enhance and improve its current products. The Company plans to expend
significant resources on the development of its new products. The successful
development of its products and product enhancements is subject to numerous
risks, both known and unknown, including:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;unanticipated delays;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;access to capital;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;budget overruns;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;technical problems; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;other difficulties that could
result in the abandonment or substantial change in the design, development and
commercialization of new products and product enhancements, including for
example, changes requested or required by governmental and regulatory agencies.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Given the
uncertainties inherent with product development and introduction of X-ray
inspection systems, the Company cannot assure that its product development
efforts will be successful on a timely basis or within budget, if at all. The
Company&#146;s failure to develop new products and product enhancements on a timely
basis or within budget would harm its business and prospects.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The Company&#146;s success
depends upon its ability to adapt to rapid changes in technology and customer
requirements.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The market for the Company&#146;s products has been characterized by rapid
technological changes, frequent product introductions and evolving industry
standards and customer requirements. The Company believes that these trends
will continue into the foreseeable future. The Company&#146;s success will depend,
in part, upon its ability to enhance its existing products, successfully
develop new products that meet changing customer and regulatory requirements
and gain market acceptance. If the Company fails to do so, its products may be
rendered obsolete or uncompetitive by new industry standards or changing
technology, in which case </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-03.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:45 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">its
revenue and operating results would suffer. In developing any new product, the
Company may be required to make a substantial investment before it can
determine the commercial viability of the new product. If the Company fails to
accurately foresee its customers&#146; needs and future activities, it may invest
heavily in research and development of products that do not lead to significant
revenue.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company may not be able to compete successfully.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A number of companies have developed products that compete with the
Company&#146;s X-ray inspection products. Many of the Company&#146;s competitors are
larger and have greater financial resources than it does. Some of its
competitors have more extensive research, marketing and manufacturing
capabilities and greater technical and personnel resources than the Company
does, and may be better positioned to continue to improve their technology in
order to compete in an evolving industry. The Company&#146;s failure to compete
successfully could decrease demand for its products or make its products
obsolete.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the inspection systems market, competition is based primarily on the
following factors:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">product
performance, functionality and quality;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">price;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the overall cost
of ownership of the system;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">prior customer
relationships;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">technological
capabilities of the product;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">certification by
government authorities;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">local market
presence; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">  </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">breadth of the
sales and service organization.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .4in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To remain competitive, the Company must develop new products and
periodically enhance its existing products in a timely manner. The Company
anticipates that it may have to adjust the prices of some of its products to
stay competitive. In addition, new competitors may emerge, and entire product
lines may be threatened by new technologies or market trends that reduce the
value of these product lines.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The Company&#146;s business could
be harmed if it is unable to protect its intellectual property.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company relies primarily on a combination of trade secrets, patents,
copyrights, trademarks, licensing arrangements and confidentiality procedures
to protect its technology. Despite its precautions, the steps the Company has
taken to protect its technology may be inadequate. Existing trade secret,
patent, trademark and copyright laws offer only limited protection. The Company&#146;s
patents could be invalidated or circumvented.&#160;
In addition, others may develop substantially equivalent or superseding
proprietary technology, or competitors may offer equivalent products in
competition with the Company&#146;s products, thereby substantially reducing the
value of the Company&#146;s proprietary rights. The laws of some foreign countries
in which the Company&#146;s products are or may be developed, manufactured or sold
may not protect its products or intellectual property rights to the same extent
as do the laws of the United States. This may make the possibility of piracy of
the Company&#146;s technology and products more likely. The Company cannot assure
that the steps it has taken to protect its intellectual property will be
adequate to prevent misappropriation of its technology. The Company&#146;s inability
to protect its intellectual property could have a negative impact on its
operations and financial results.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company&#146;s business may be materially and adversely affected by infringement
claims initiated by the Company or its competitors.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Initiating or
defending against the enforcement of the Company&#146;s intellectual property rights
may result in significant, protracted, and costly litigation. The Company has
previously been involved in various litigations involving its intellectual
property and has been successful in protecting such interests to date. The
Company expects intellectual property disputes to be an ordinary part of its
business for the foreseeable future. The Company may initiate claims or
litigation against third parties for infringement of its intellectual property
rights, or to establish the validity of its property rights. There can be no
assurance that the Company will prevail in any such action. Litigation by or
against the Company could result in significant expense and divert the efforts
of technical and management personnel, whether or not such litigation results
in a favorable outcome for the Company. In the event of an adverse result in
any such litigation, the Company could be required to pay substantial damages,
cease the manufacture, use and sale of infringing products, expend significant
resources to develop non-infringing technology, discontinue </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-03.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:45 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the use of certain
processes, or obtain licenses for the infringing technology. If a license were
required, the Company cannot assure that it would be able to obtain one on
commercially reasonable terms, if at all. The Company cannot assure that it
will be successful in developing non-infringing technology or that the cost or
time required to develop such technology will be reasonable.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
Company&#146;s success depends on its ability to attract and retain qualified
management professionals.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
future success depends in large measure upon the continued contributions of its
senior management team and other key personnel.&#160;
We cannot guarantee that we will be able to attract and retain key
personnel or executive management in sufficient numbers, with the requisite
skills or on acceptable terms necessary or advisable to support our continued
growth.&#160; If we lose professionals or are
unable to attract new talent, we will not be able to maintain our position in
the market or grow our business.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Existing
external financing may not be available in the future.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company may
require additional capital to finance continuing operations. The Company cannot
assure that operations will continue to be profitable, that it will generate
levels of revenues and cash flows sufficient to fund operations, or, if
necessary, that the Company will be able to obtain additional financing on
satisfactory terms, if at all. Any existing financing arrangements may not be
available or sufficient to meet the Company&#146;s cash needs or may not be
available in the future, or, if available, at a cost that the Company believes
is reasonable.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Future
sales of the Company&#146;s common stock by existing stockholders could depress the
market price of the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Substantially all
of the Company&#146;s outstanding shares of common stock are freely tradable without
restriction or further registration. Affiliates must sell all shares they own
in compliance with the volume and other requirements of Rule&nbsp;144, except
for the holding period requirements. Nevertheless, sales of substantial amounts
of common stock by the Company&#146;s stockholders, or even the potential for such
sales, may cause the market price of the Company&#146;s common stock to decline and
could impair the Company&#146;s ability to raise capital through the sale of the
Company&#146;s equity securities.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The
volatility of the Company&#146;s stock price could adversely affect an investment in
the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The market price
of the Company&#146;s common stock has been, and may continue to be, highly
volatile. The Company believes that a variety of factors could cause the price
of the Company&#146;s common stock to fluctuate, perhaps substantially, including:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> announcements of developments related to
the Company&#146;s business;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> quarterly fluctuations in the Company&#146;s
actual or anticipated operating results and order levels;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> general conditions in the worldwide
economy;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> announcements of technological
innovations;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> new products or product enhancements by
the Company or its competitors;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> developments in patents or other
intellectual property rights and litigation; and</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;"> developments in the Company&#146;s
relationships with its customers and suppliers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, in
recent years the stock market in general, and the markets for shares of small
capitalization and &#147;high-tech&#148; companies in particular, have experienced
extreme price fluctuations which have often been unrelated to the operating
performance of affected companies. Any such fluctuations in the future could
adversely affect the market price of the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Provisions
in the Company&#146;s articles of organization and the Company&#146;s shareholder rights
plan may have the effect of discouraging advantageous offers for the Company&#146;s
business or common stock, and limit the price that investors might be willing
to pay in the future for shares of the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Provisions in the
Company&#146;s articles of organization and the Company&#146;s shareholder rights plan
may have the effect of discouraging or preventing a change in control. These
provisions could limit the price that certain investors might be willing to pay
in the future for shares of the Company&#146;s common stock. Specifically, the
Company&#146;s articles of organization authorize its Board of Directors to issue up
to 100,000 shares of preferred stock in one or more series, to fix certain
rights, preferences, privileges and </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-03.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:45 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">restrictions granted to
or imposed upon any wholly unissued shares of preferred stock, to fix the
number of shares constituting any such series, and to fix the designation of
any such series, without further vote or action by its shareholders. The terms
of any series of preferred stock, which may include priority claims to assets
and dividends and special voting rights, could adversely affect the rights of
the holders of common stock and thereby reduce the value of the Company&#146;s
common stock. The Company has no present plans to issue shares of preferred
stock. The Company has in place a shareholder rights plan, which was renewed in
April&nbsp;of 2008, under which its stockholders are entitled to purchase
shares of its preferred stock under certain circumstances. These circumstances
include the purchase of 15% or more of the outstanding shares of common stock
by a person or group, or the announcement of a tender or exchange offer to
acquire 15% or more of the outstanding common stock. The shareholder rights
plan may have the effect of impeding or preventing certain types of
transactions involving a change in control of the Company that could be
beneficial to the stockholders.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM
1B.&#160; UNRESOLVED STAFF COMMENTS</font></b><a name="Item1b_UnresolvedStaffComments_084446"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There are no
unresolved written comments that were received from the SEC staff 180 days or
more before the end of our fiscal year relating to our periodic or current
reports under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 2.
PROPERTIES</font></b><a name="Item2_Properties_084452"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company leases
an 188,000 square foot facility located in Billerica, Massachusetts which is
owned by an unaffiliated real estate limited partnership and serves as the
Company&#146;s executive offices, research, manufacturing and warehouse
facilities.&#160; The lease expires on February&nbsp;29,
2016.&#160; The Company believes that its
facilities are adequate and provide sufficient production capacity for its
present intended purposes. The Company&#146;s facilities are currently utilized
primarily on a one-shift basis. The Company is able to add additional capacity
by adding second and third shifts if necessary.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
former High Energy Systems division had leased 24,733 square feet of
manufacturing, research and development, and office space in Mountain View,
California. The lease commenced on February&nbsp;1, 2004 and had an initial
term of seven years with an option to extend for an additional five-year
period. In January&nbsp;2005, as part of the asset sale agreement with Accuray,
Incorporated, the Company assigned its rights and obligations under this lease
to Accuray. The Company is secondarily liable for the lease payments in the
event of default by Accuray.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 3.&#160; LEGAL PROCEEDINGS</font></b><a name="Item3_LegalProceedings_084504"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October&nbsp;3,
2007, the Company commenced litigation in the United States District Court for
the Eastern District of Virginia against AutoClear, LLC, and its affiliates
Control Screening, LLC, and Scan-Tech Security, LP, for infringement of the
Company&#146;s United States Patent No.&nbsp;5,313,511, seeking damages and
injunctive relief. The parties have recently begun discovery in this matter.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;4,
2007, the Company received a notice from the United States Environmental
Protection Agency (the &#147;EPA&#148;) that it may potentially be liable for certain
costs related to the proposed clean-up at the Sutton Brook Disposal Area
Superfund Site located in Tewksbury, Massachusetts. The Company is one of
approximately 45 entities identified by the EPA as a Potentially Responsible
Party (&#147;PRP&#148;) in connection with alleged historical disposal of waste materials
for the period from 1958 through the mid-1980s, the timeframe under
investigation by the EPA. The Company has denied liability, and has initiated
participation in the global negotiation and settlement processes with the EPA
and with other PRPs. Such negotiation processes are ongoing.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is
also subject to various legal proceedings and claims that arise in the ordinary
course of business.&nbsp; At the present time, it is not possible to predict
the outcome of these matters; however, the Company currently believes that
resolving these matters will not have a material adverse impact on its
financial condition, results of operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 4. SUBMISSION OF MATTERS TO A VOTE OF
SECURITY HOLDERS</font></b><a name="Item4_SubmissionOfMattersToAVoteO_084511"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No matter was
submitted to a vote of the Company&#146;s security holders during the fourth quarter
of the fiscal year covered by this report.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-03.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:45 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART&nbsp;II</font></b><a name="Partii_084536"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 5<a name="Item5_201005"></a>. MARKET FOR THE
COMPANY&#146;S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS, AND ISSUER PURCHASES OF
EQUITY SECURITIES</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Market Information</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our common stock
is traded on the NASDAQ National Market under the symbol ASEI. The market price
range for the common stock for the last two fiscal years as reported on the
NASDAQ National Market is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Holders</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of May&nbsp;28, 2008,
there were approximately 744 holders of record of the Company&#146;s common stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;13, 2008, the Company declared another quarterly dividend of
$0.20 for holders of record on May&nbsp;19, 2008 to be paid June&nbsp;6, 2008. </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No cash dividends were declared during
the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2007.&#160;
The Company has received consent from its bank for these dividends as
its credit facility restricts the payment of dividends (except in shares of the
Company&#146;s stock). &nbsp;Future dividend payments will depend on our earnings,
capital requirements, financial condition and capital needs and other factors
considered relevant by our Board.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Purchases of Equity Securities</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:24.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
May&nbsp;17, 2007, the Board of Directors approved a Stock Repurchase Program
which authorized the Company to repurchase up to $35 million of shares of its
common stock from time to time on the open market.&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2008, the maximum dollar
value of shares that may yet be purchased under the program totaled $9,832,000.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:24.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:24.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table provides information about our purchases during the quarter
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 of equity securities that are registered by us
pursuant to Section&nbsp;12 of the Exchange Act.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">214,555</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.04%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:24.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
May&nbsp;8, 2008 the Board of Directors approved another Stock Repurchase
Program which authorizes the Company to repurchase up to $35 million of shares
of its common stock from time to time on the open market.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:24.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Stock Performance Graph</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:16.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following chart
graphs the performance of the cumulative total return to shareholders (stock
price appreciation plus dividends, if applicable) during the previous five
years in comparison to the returns of the Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s 500
Composite Stock Price Index and the Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s 500 Information
Technology Composite Stock Price Index.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:16.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Total Return to Shareholders</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;(Dividends reinvested monthly)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>
