<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 9A.
CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</font></b><a name="Item9a_ControlsAndProcedures_202321"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Evaluation
of Disclosure Controls and Procedures</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of the end of
the period covered by this report, under the supervision and with the
participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and
Chief Financial Officer, the Company reviewed and evaluated the effectiveness
of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures pursuant to Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;and
15d-15(e)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 as amended (the &#147;Exchange
Act&#148;). Based upon their evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief
Financial Officer concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were
effective as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 to ensure that information required to be
disclosed by the Company in the reports filed and submitted by it under the
Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time
period specified in the Securities and Exchange Commission&#146;s rules&nbsp;and
forms, and to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be
disclosed by the Company in such reports is accumulated and communicated to the
Company&#146;s management, including its Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial
Officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required
disclosure.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over
Financial Reporting</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .2in;text-indent:-.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our management is
responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over
financial reporting, as such term is defined in Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f)&nbsp;and
15d-15(f)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act.&#160; Our
management conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control
over financial reporting using the framework in &#147;Internal Control-Integrated
Framework&#148; issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway
Commission.&#160; Based on this evaluation
under the criteria established in &#147;Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework&#148;,
our management concluded that the Company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting was effective as of March&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; Vitale, Caturano&nbsp;&amp; Company, Ltd.,
our independent registered public accounting firm, has audited the
effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting as of March&nbsp;31,
2008, and has issued their report thereon which is included herein.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Changes
in Internal Controls over Financial Reporting</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>have<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>been<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>no<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>changes<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>in<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>our<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>internal<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>control<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>over<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>financial<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>reporting,<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>as<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>such<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>term<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>is<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>defin
ed<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>in<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>Rules<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>13a-15(f)<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>and<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>15d-15(f)<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>of<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>the<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>Exchange<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>Act,<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>during<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>the<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>quarter<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>ended<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>March<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>31,<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>2008<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>that<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>have<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>mate
rially<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>affected,<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>or<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>are<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>reasonably<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>likely<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>to<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>materially<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>affect,<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>the<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>Company&#146;s<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>internal<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>control<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>over<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>financial<font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">  </font>reporting.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 9B.
OTHER INFORMATION</font></b><a name="Item9b_OtherInformation_202326"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART&nbsp;III</font></b><a name="Partiii_202330"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 10.
DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE</font></b><a name="Item10_DirectorsExecutiveOfficers_202333"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Code of
Conduct</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has
adopted a Code of Conduct that applies to our Board of Directors, Chief
Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, and all employees of the Company.
The Company&#146;s Code of Conduct is posted on our website at www.as-e.com and may
be accessed in the Corporate Governance section of the Investor Information
page. The Company intends to satisfy the disclosure requirement under Item 10
of Form&nbsp;8-K, regarding an amendment to, or waiver from, our Code of
Conduct, by posting such information on our website at the location specified
above.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The other
information called for by this item is hereby incorporated by reference from
the Registrant&#146;s Definitive Proxy Statement relating to the 2008 Annual Meeting
of Stockholders, which Proxy Statement will be filed with the Securities and
Exchange Commission on or about July&nbsp;29, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 11.
EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</font></b><a name="Item11_ExecutiveCompensation_202337"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information
called for by this item is hereby incorporated by reference from the Registrant&#146;s
Definitive Proxy Statement relating to the 2008 Annual Meeting of Stockholders,
which Proxy Statement will be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
on or about July&nbsp;29, 2008.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 12<a name="Item12_202343"></a>. SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND
MANAGEMENT AND RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information
called for by this item is hereby incorporated by reference from the Registrant&#146;s
Definitive Proxy Statement relating to the 2008 Annual Meeting of Stockholders,
which Proxy Statement will be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
on or about July&nbsp;29, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 13.
CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS, AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE</font></b><a name="Item13_CertainRelationshipsAndRel_202348"></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information
called for by this item is hereby incorporated by reference from the Registrant&#146;s
Definitive Proxy Statement relating to the 2008 Annual Meeting of Stockholders,
which Proxy Statement will be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
on or about July&nbsp;29, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 14.

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING
FIRM</font></b><a name="ReportOfIndependentRegisteredPubl_132322"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To the
Board of Directors and Stockholders</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of American Science and
Engineering,&nbsp;Inc.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited the
accompanying consolidated balance sheets of American Science and Engineering,&nbsp;Inc.
and subsidiary (&#147;the Company&#148;) as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 and the
related consolidated statements of operations, stockholders&#146; equity and
comprehensive income, and cash flows for each of the years ended March&nbsp;31,
2008, 2007 and 2006.&#160; We also have
audited American Science and Engineering,&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiary&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting as of March&nbsp;31, 2008, based on criteria
established in <i>Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework</i>
issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission
(COSO). Management is responsible for these financial statements, for
maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its
assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.
Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and
an opinion on the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting based on
our audits.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We conducted our audits
in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight
Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the
audits to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements
are free of material misstatement and whether effective internal control over
financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit of the
financial statements included examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting
the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the
accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, and
evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. Our audit of internal
control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of
internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material
weakness exists, and testing and evaluating the design and operating
effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk.&#160; Our audits also included performing such
other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe
that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinions.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A company&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation
of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally
accepted accounting principles. A company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1)&nbsp;pertain to the
maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly
reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)&nbsp;provide
reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit
preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted
accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are
being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors
of the company; and (3)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention
or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s
assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because of its inherent
limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or
detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future
periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of
changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or
procedures may deteriorate.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In our opinion, the
financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material
respects, the consolidated financial position of American Science and
Engineering,&nbsp;Inc. and subsidiary as of March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 and
the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three
years in the period ended March&nbsp;31, 2008 in conformity with accounting
principles generally accepted in the United States of America. Also, in our
opinion, American Science and Engineering,&nbsp;Inc. maintained, in all
material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of March&nbsp;31,
2008 based on criteria established in <i>Internal
Control&#151;Integrated Framework</i> issued by the Committee of Sponsoring
Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO).</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in Note 1 to
the consolidated financial statements, the Company adopted SFAS No.&nbsp;123(R),
Share-Based Payment, effective April&nbsp;1, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  Caturano&nbsp;&amp; Company, Ltd.</font></p>
  </td>

<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AMERICAN SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING,
INC. AND SUBSIDIARY</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF
STOCKHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY AND COMPREHENSIVE INCOME</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR THE

except share amounts)</font></p>

  <td width="22%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:22.12%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Tax benefit
  accrued on stock option exercises</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.88%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.26%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.12%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accompanying notes are an integral part of these consolidated financial
statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\JMS\C900154\08-15969-1\task2985867\15969-1-ba-05.htm',USER='c900154',CD='Jun 13 09:46 2008' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AMERICAN SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING, INC. AND
SUBSIDIARY</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b><a name="NotesToConsolidatedFinancialState_195532"></a></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1. NATURE
OF OPERATIONS AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">American Science
and Engineering,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) is engaged in the development and
manufacture of sophisticated X-ray inspection systems for critical detection
and security screening solutions for sale primarily to U.S. and foreign
government agencies.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Principles
of Consolidation</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The consolidated
financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its wholly owned
subsidiary. All significant inter-company balances and transactions have been
eliminated in consolidation.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Use of
Estimates</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The preparation of
financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally
accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates
and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and
disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial
statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the
reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash and
Cash Equivalents</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
considers all investments with original maturities of 90 days or less to be
cash equivalents.&#160; The Company maintains
cash and cash equivalent balances with financial institutions that exceed
federally insured limits.&#160; The Company
has not experienced any losses related to these balances, and management
believes its credit risk to be minimal. Cash and cash equivalents are carried
at cost, which approximates fair market value at fiscal year-end 2008 and 2007.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Restricted
Cash and Investments</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s loan
and security agreement with its bank require certain cash and investment
balances to be restricted as collateral against outstanding standby letters of
credit. The restricted cash amounts with Silicon Valley Bank are in the form of
certificates of deposits that mature beyond 90 days.&#160; Restrictions that mature beyond one year are
classified as long-term in the accompanying balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Short-term
Investments and Cash Equivalents</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Short-term investments and cash equivalents consist of
investments in money market funds, certificates of deposit, commercial paper
and corporate debentures/bonds. These investments are classified as
available-for-sale and are recorded at their fair market values using the
specific identification method. The unrealized holding gains or losses on these
securities are included as a component of comprehensive income in the
Consolidated Statements of Stockholders&#146; Equity and Comprehensive Income.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="90%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:90.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">

  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-15969-1\task2984649\15969-1-ba-07.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jun 12 20:35 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Accounts
Receivable and Unbilled Costs and Fees</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accounts
receivable are recorded at the invoiced amount. Amounts collected on trade
accounts receivable are included in net cash provided by operating activities
in the consolidated statements of cash flows. The Company maintains an
allowance for doubtful accounts for estimated losses inherent in its accounts
receivable portfolio. The allowance for doubtful accounts reflects our best
estimate of probable losses inherent in the accounts receivable balance. We
determine the allowance based on known troubled accounts, historical
experience, and other currently available evidence. Activity in the allowance for
doubtful accounts is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="85%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:85.0%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fiscal 2007 and
2006, the Company had a net credit to bad debt expense as it collected on
certain accounts receivable balances which were significantly aged and deemed
to be uncollectible at the prior year ends.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in
accounts receivable and unbilled costs and fees at March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007
are $20,822,000 and $23,976,000, respectively, attributable to both prime and
subcontracts with federal and state governments. The Company establishes a reserve
against unbilled costs and fees based on known troubled accounts or contracts,
historical experience, and other currently available evidence. There was not
activity in the reserve for unbilled costs and fees during fiscal 2008.&#160; Activity in the allowance for unbilled costs
and fees for fiscal 2007 and 2006 is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Inventories</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories
consist of material, labor and manufacturing overhead and are recorded at the
lower of cost, using the weighted average cost method, or net realizable value.
Excessive manufacturing overhead costs attributable to idle facility expenses,
freight, handling costs and wasted material (spoilage) attributable to
abnormally low production volumes (levels that materially differ from budgeted
production plans due primarily to changes in customer demand) are excluded from
inventory and recorded as an expense in the period incurred.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The components of
inventories at March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,199</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-15969-1\task2984649\15969-1-ba-07.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jun 12 20:35 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
periodically reviews quantities of inventory on hand and compares these amounts
to expected usage of each particular product or product line. The Company
records, as a charge to cost of sales, any amounts required to reduce the
carrying value to net realizable value.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes Receivable</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2007
and 2008, the Company loaned a potential acquisition target $1,608,000 million
under an interest bearing note receivable.&#160;
During fiscal 2008, the Company abandoned this acquisition and evaluated
the collectibility of the note to determine if there was any risk of default.
The Company determined that there was risk of default, and during the year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, the Company wrote off this note receivable and the
related accrued interest receivable as an uncollectible debt. The write-off is
included in general and administrative expense for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31,
2008.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Building,</font></b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">  <b>Equipment and Leasehold
Improvements</b></font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">provides</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">for</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">depreciation</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">amortization</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">its</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font
 size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">fixed</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">assets</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">on</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">straight-line</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">basis</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">over</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">estimated</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">useful</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">lives</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><f
ont size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3-11</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">years</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">or</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">remaining</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">lease</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">terms.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Expenditures</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">for</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">normal</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><
font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">maintenance</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">repairs</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">are</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">charged</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">to</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">expense</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">as</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">incurred.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Significant</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;"> 
 </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">additions,</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">renewals</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">or</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">betterments</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">that</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">extend</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">useful</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">lives</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt
;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">assets</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">are</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">capitalized</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">at</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">cost.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">cost</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">accumulated</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;"
>  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">depreciation</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">applicable</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">to</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">equipment</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">leasehold</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">improvements</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">sold,</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">or</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">otherwise</font><font size="1" styl
e="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">disposed</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of,</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">are</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">removed</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">from</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">accounts,</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">any</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">resulting</font><font size="1" style
="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">gain</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">or</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">loss</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">is</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">included</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">in</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">consolidated</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">statements</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of</font><font size="1" style="fo
nt-size:7.5pt;">  </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Building,
equipment and leasehold improvements consisted of the following at March&nbsp;31:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Revenue
Recognition</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
recognizes certain CargoSearch and Z Backscatter system sales and other product
revenue, primarily ParcelSearch systems and after-market parts, in accordance
with SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin (&#147;SAB&#148;)No.&nbsp;101, Revenue Recognition in
Financial Statements modified by SAB No.&nbsp;104 which requires that four
basic criteria must be met before revenue can be recognized: (1)&nbsp;persuasive
evidence of an arrangement exists; (2)&nbsp;delivery has occurred or services
rendered; (3)&nbsp;the fee is fixed and determinable; and (4)&nbsp;collectibility
is reasonably assured.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain of the
Company&#146;s contracts are multiple-element arrangements, which include standard
products, custom-built systems or contract engineering projects, services, such
as training and service contracts. In accordance with Emerging Issues Task
Force Issue No.&nbsp;00-21, &#147;Revenue Arrangements with Multiple Deliverables,&#148;
(&#147;EITF 00-21&#148;) revenue arrangements that include multiple elements are analyzed
to determine whether the deliverables can be divided into separate units of
accounting or treated as a single unit of accounting. The consideration the
Company receives is allocated among the separate units of accounting based on
their relative fair values determined based on prices of these elements as sold
on a stand-alone basis, and the applicable revenue recognition criteria are
applied to each of the separate units. There is no customer right of return in
the Company&#146;s sales agreements.&#160; Revenues
are allocated to a delivered product or service when all of the following
criteria are met: (1)&nbsp;the delivered item has value to the customer on a
standalone basis; (2)&nbsp;there is objective and reliable evidence of the fair
value of the undelivered item; and (3)&nbsp;if the arrangement includes a
general right of return relative to the delivered item, delivery or performance
of the undelivered item is considered probable and substantially in our
control.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenues for
certain long-term, custom-built systems or contract engineering projects are
recognized on a percentage of completion basis. The lengths of these contracts
typically range from 9 to 24 months from order to delivery and acceptance. Percentages-of-completion
are determined by relating the actual costs of work performed to date for each
contract to its estimated final costs. Revisions in costs and profit estimates
are reflected in the period in which the facts causing the revision become
known.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-15969-1\task2984649\15969-1-ba-07.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jun 12 20:35 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Training and
service contracts deliverables are accounted for separately from the delivered
product elements as the Company&#146;s undelivered products have value to its
customers on a stand-alone basis and the Company has objective and reliable
evidence of the fair value of such services. Accordingly, service revenue
representing the fair value of services not yet performed at the time of
product shipment is deferred and recognized as such services are performed.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain contracts
require payments from the customer upon execution of the agreement that are
included in customer deposits. Individual customer deposits are reduced by the
amount of revenue recognized on the contract until a zero balance is reached.
Revenue recognized in excess of billings under the contracts is included in
unbilled costs and fees in the accompanying balance sheet. Of the amounts in
unbilled costs and fees at March&nbsp;31, 2008, $6,040,000 (99%) is expected to
be billed and collected during fiscal 2009.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For all fixed
price and long-term contracts, if a loss is anticipated on the contract, a
provision is made in the period in which such losses are determined.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Under the terms of certain of its cost reimbursement contracts, the Company is not permitted to bill customers a specified portion of the contract value until completion. Such retainages (approximately $74,000 and $46,000 at March&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, respectively)&#160; result from both commercial contract retentions and government contract withholdings generally for up to 15% of fees, as well as the difference between the actual and provisional indirect cost billing rates. Retainages are included in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as components of unbilled costs and fees. The accuracy and appropriateness of the Company&#146;s direct and indirect costs and expenses under these cost reimbursement contracts and its accounts receivable recorded pursuant to such contracts, are subject to regulation and audit, including by 
the U.S.&#160; Defense Contract Audit Agency (&#147;DCAA&#148;) or by other appropriate agencies of the U.S. Government.&#160; Such agencies have the right to challenge the Company&#146;s cost estimates or allocations with respect to any government contract.&#160; Additionally, a portion of the payments to the Company under government contracts are provisional payments that are subject to potential adjustment upon audit by such agencies.&#160; Historically, such audits have not resulted in any significant disallowed costs.&#160; Although the Company can give no assurances, in the opinion of management, any adjustments likely to result from inquiries or audits of its contracts will not have a material adverse </font><font color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;">impact on the Company&#146;s financial condition or results of operations.</font></p><p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&n
bsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
recognizes sales for its systems that are produced in a standard manufacturing
operation, have minimal customer site installation requirements and have
shorter order to delivery cycles when title passes and when other revenue
recognition criteria are met. Management believes the customer&#146;s post-delivery
acceptance provisions and installation requirements on these systems are
perfunctory and inconsequential and the costs of installation at the customer&#146;s
site are accrued at the time of revenue recognition.&#160; The Company has demonstrated a history of
customer acceptance subsequent to shipment and installation of these
systems.&#160; For systems which entail more
significant installation efforts and site work and/or have non-standard customer
acceptance provisions, revenue recognition is deferred until installation is
complete and customer acceptance has occurred.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Service revenues
are recognized on time and materials engagements as the services are provided.
Service contract revenues are recognized on a straight-line basis over the
length of the contract which reasonably approximates the period service
revenues are earned.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
records billed shipping and handling fees and billed out-of-pocket expenses as
revenue and the associated costs as cost of goods sold in the accompanying
consolidated statements of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Warranty
Costs</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
generally provides on certain of its products a one year parts and labor
warranty with the purchase of domestic equipment, and a one year parts only
warranty on international equipment. The anticipated cost for this one year
warranty is accrued for at the time of the sale based upon historical
experience and management&#146;s estimates of future liabilities, and is recorded as
accrued warranty costs (See Note 5).</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Deferred
Revenue</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company offers
to its customers extended warranty and service contracts. These contracts
typically have a coverage period of one to five years, and include advance
payments that are recorded as deferred revenue. Revenue is recognized on a
straight-line basis over the life of the contract, which reasonably
approximates the period these revenues are earned. Costs associated with these
extended warranty and service contracts are expensed to cost of goods sold as
incurred.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="left"></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\JMS\105627\08-15969-1\task2984649\15969-1-ba-07.htm',USER='105627',CD='Jun 12 20:35 2008' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Impairment
of Long-Lived Assets</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-lived assets
are reviewed for possible impairment whenever events or changes in
circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of such assets may not be
recoverable in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;144, Accounting for the Impairment
and Disposal of Long-Lived Assets.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment is
assessed by comparing the estimated undiscounted cash flows over the asset&#146;s
remaining life to the carrying amount of the asset. If the estimated cash flows
are insufficient to recover the asset, an impairment loss is recognized based
on the difference between the carrying value of the asset and the fair value of
the asset less any costs of disposal.&#160; No
impairment costs were recorded in the fiscal years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008,
2007 and 2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Accrued
Salaries and Benefits</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accrued salaries
and benefits at March&nbsp;31, 2008 and March&nbsp;31, 2007 include the
following:</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:80.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.62%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,935</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.38%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.26%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7,241</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Customer
Deposits</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For most
international orders, the Company generally includes, as part of its terms and
conditions, an advance deposit with order acceptance. For long-term
international contracts, the Company will generally include milestone payments
tied to a specific event and/or passage of time. These deposit amounts are
recorded as a liability under Customer Deposits until reduced by revenue
recognized against the specific contract.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Research
and Development</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Internally funded
research and development costs including direct labor, material, subcontractor
expenses and related overheads are expensed as incurred. Internally funded
research and development costs were $12,306,000, $7,184,000, and $9,601,000 in
fiscal 2008, 2007, and 2006, respectively.&#160;
In addition, the Company recognized revenues of $13,978,000, $6,597,000,
and $2,804,000, in fiscal 2008, 2007, and 2006, respectively related to
government-sponsored research and development earned primarily on a cost
reimbursement and fee basis as discussed above.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fair
Value of Financial Instruments</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
financial instruments consist primarily of cash and cash equivalents,
short-term investments, accounts receivable, unbilled costs and fees, accounts
payable, warrant liability and letters of credit. The recorded amounts of these
instruments approximate fair value.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Income
per Common and Potential Common Shares</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.2in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic earnings per
common share is computed by dividing net income available to common
stockholders by the weighted average number of shares of common stock
outstanding during the year. Diluted earnings per share include the dilutive
impact of options, warrants, restricted stock and restricted stock units using
the average share price of the Company&#146;s common stock for the period. For the
years ended March&nbsp;31, 2008, 2007, and 2006, respectively, common stock
equivalents of 253,000, 108,000, and 72,000 are excluded from diluted earnings
per share, as their effect is anti-dilutive.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
